verbose_text: Cells adjust the localization of mitochondria to meet different functional needs : the role of peripheral mitochondria is to produce ATP for cell motility and secretion and to regulate calcium concentration at the plasma membrane XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, while central mitochondria are involved in calcium signaling in the ER and in the cell apoptosis pathway XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR.
